page.title: 19 BETLEY SCHOOL IN THE 1930'S
page.content: 55 years ago Mr.Harold Foster was a pupil at our school,when the headmaster was Mr.Leece,the other teachers were Miss Wilson,Miss Riley,Miss Cross and Miss Jones.Some days after school Miss Jones taught ballroom dancing,all the children enjoyed that.The kind of games the children played were whip and top and bowlers which were metal hoops,also they played cricket and football .In the 1930's the classes were large,about 40 in each,now there are about 20.In most schools they used pens which you had to dip into an ink pot,and some children flicked ink around the room, which made a big mess.In those days children were punished quite often with the cane.In some schools they had dinners but Betley didn't,the children had to go home for dinner.Children started school at the age of 5 and left at 14.Now the leaving age is 16.
